WRITING.TITLE: Breaking Benjamin is helping me so much right now.
WRITING.TEXT: Longtime reddit lurker, recently made an account so I could join this group. Without going into anything too personal, I'm at a place in my life right now where I've become trapped in an emotionally abusive situation, and Breaking Benjamin's music has been my peace from that. I've been a fan since I first heard "So Cold" on the radio, so going on 15 years or so now, but with my recent life events I've found myself relating to more and more of their songs; tracks that never jumped out at me before are coming back to me like old friends, providing much-needed comfort. Lately I've been playing BB's entire discography like a security blanket. My escape from the world. I dunno if Ben ever looks at reddit, but if he does, I hope he knows what a difference his music has made in my life, and in the lives of so many others. I'm truly proud to call myself a fan of this band.

"Breath" is a pretty good description of how I feel. The lyrics in "Water" really resonate with me because it's like listening to a song about the way the guy talks to me. I'm also finding a lot of comfort in "Hollow", "Crawl", and "The Diary of Jane". But really, anything by them is a comfort.
Thanks so much!
Beautiful tattoo! Thinking of getting one on my left arm. Just don't want to ruin it at work.
I would switch Ember and Dear Agony, but otherwise this is is what I'd say, too. Glad to see Saturate at the top where it belongs. :p
Thanks so much, and I hope things are going better for you now!

Thank you, but I already know all of Dark Before Dawn (and Ember, for that matter). Those are just the songs I'm clinging to at the moment. "Defeated", too. "I know what I need, and it's not you! It's not you!"

Thank you for the suggestions! I don't know that I'm even sad, more that I feel powerless to resolve my situation, because the person causing my pain seemingly can't be stopped. I think honestly, listening to Ben yell and proclaim such powerful things, i.e. "I can't feel anything at all!" or "You wish you were, you're not my friend!" or "You greedy little bastard, you will get what you deserve!" ...that makes ME feel powerful when I sing along with him, like for that moment I have control over what I'm going through. I've been keeping lyrics in my head like shields.
Signed! Also, it is helpful to call Nintendo and leave feedback. I just did and my opinion was recorded and passed along.
Oh my god. I love it.
Yeah I actually really like these lyrics, the symbolism is superb. Pretty awkward to sing out loud, though.
Oh gosh, I love this! The colors especially.

WRITING.TITLE: I'm a line cook considering a move to Maine. Advice?
WRITING.TEXT: I am a 30 year old single female born and raised in Massachusetts. I have relatives who live in Maine a little north of Belfast and it has always been a dream of mine to move up there, someday, somewhere. I currently make about $40,000 a year as a line cook and recently got pre-qualified for a mortgage up to $200,000...in Massachusetts. Where I live, $200,000 gets you either a piece of land, a mobile home, or a shack that needs to be torn down...none of which I'm interested in. In Maine, you can buy a 3 bedroom house for that kind of money. So I've shifted gears and finally started seriously considering making my dream a reality. I'm autistic, prefer my solitude, and love nature. I dream of living comfortably in a modest home surrounded by trees. My worry is finding a job. People who live in Maine, where would you say is the best area for me to find year-round work as a line cook? I want to be further north than Portland, but no further north than Bangor. I realize a lot of restaurants close for the winter up there, which scares me. Any advice would be greatly appreciated and help put my mind at ease.
Thank you for the advice!
Thank you, that's nice to hear. :)
Yeah, I recognize that a lot of my money comes from overtime, too. I'm definitely going to have to live on a tighter budget if I make the move.
Thank you, I hadn't looked at Brunswick yet!
If I did do Portland, I'd be looking at the surrounding towns as far as buying property and then commute into the city for work. But I realize there is a good restaurant community there. :)
Thank you so much for all of that info! I'm glad your friend's son is doing well there, that's giving me some inspiration! :)
$15 an hour and 10 hours of overtime a week at a very popular, privately-owned restaurant.
I figured this, and it sucks because Bangor was always where I wanted to live if I moved up there. But I kinda guessed it maybe wouldn't be a great place for me to make a living. Too far north.
I haven't, but I will!
I read a fan theory once. Her glock holds six bullets. When Spike leaves for the last time, she only fires five...

WRITING.TITLE: Just saw my first BB concert in Mansfield!
WRITING.TEXT: Ben and the band were everything I expected them to be and more. I love how much Ben interacts with the crowd, and I love that the other band members sang some of the songs. The energy in that place was amazing, you could just tell how happy everyone was, and Ben seemed like he was having a genuinely great time. Maybe two thirds through he gave a small speech about how much he appreciates all of us for supporting them, and that by listening to their music and singing it back, we're letting them vent to us, we're their therapy. I found that to be an especially beautiful sentiment, because BB's music is definitely a form of therapy for me. Maybe it's sappy, but I'm an extremely empathetic person, so looking up to a musician who's not afraid to share an emotional connection with his fans is pretty ideal for me. Incidentally, Chevelle was also absolutely flawless. I had never seen them live before either, and their performance perfectly matched their amazing music. Watching them was like watching their music, as I picture it, come to life, which is what I'd think any artist would hope to convey at a show. If I had to choose two bands to see together, it'd be these two. I hope they tour together again! Next time I'm buying a VIP ticket for sure.
Me too! They seem like they'd be good friends to have. :)
My head's so fucked up inside.
I know in MA it was Diamante, Dorothy, Three Days Grace, Chevelle, Breaking Benjamin. I've seen others from other places post the same lineup in the same order.
Wish I May!
So Cold! (watching him sing this part was amazing)
I brought you to life so I could hear you scream.
Phase
"No Games", "Phase", and "Water" are up there for me. Also "Lie To Me". I feel like Saturate in general isn't acknowledged enough anymore, and that makes me sad. It's easily my favorite album.
Really glad to see Water on there!
I burn myself. Brand myself, really. Second degree burns. They get infected a lot and take forever to heal. I wouldn't recommend it.
